studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Modification of the specific KCCQ scoring metric used for secondary endpoints.
Addition of a new Echocardiographic Sub-study including objectives and procedures.
Expansion of Adverse Events of Interest to include preceding events for amputations.
Clarification of exclusion criteria and extension of contraceptive requirements.
Removal of adjudication requirements for specific renal endpoints.
Simplification of SAE reporting by limiting event types withheld from health authorities.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Discussion with regulatory authorities regarding amputation risks.
Feedback from regulatory authorities and harmonization with the Informed Consent Form (ICF).
Endpoint criteria did not justify the adjudication of eGFR decline events.
Protocol mandated laboratory values are systematically analyzed, making separate AE recording redundant unless meeting SAE/DAE criteria.
Minimize risk for withholding renal AEs of interest which could be confused for endpoints.

studyChanges.beforeText: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ) clinical/overall symptom score
studyChanges.afterText: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ) total symptom score
studyChanges.summary: Changed the specific KCCQ score used for secondary variable analysis.

studyChanges.afterText: AEs leading to amputation and AEs leading to a risk for lower limb amputations (“preceding events”)
studyChanges.summary: Expanded amputation AE category to include risk-preceding events.
Updated contraceptive requirements based on regulatory feedback.

studyChanges.beforeText: Requirement of adjudicating potential endpoints related to eGFR decline
studyChanges.summary: Removed adjudication requirement for eGFR decline endpoints.

studyChanges.afterText: Clarification regarding investigator responsibility for standard of care treatment after IP discontinuation
studyChanges.summary: Added guidelines for post-IP treatment responsibilities.
